author: .someoneanonymous
content: I think the block time target is based on roughly how long it will take for other miners/validators to be able to receive and verify a block before they can start building on it.

author: .someoneanonymous
content: Difficult adjusts to ensure that the average block time is around 13 seconds (as of now), but if the block time was cut in half, the difficulty calculation would adjust to ensure the average block time was around 7-ish seconds.

author: .someoneanonymous
content:
A block time that’s too small gives the miner who found the previous block an advantage towards finding the next one since they don’t have to wait to receive and validate the block (since they just created it). 

In PoS that will be a bit different since there no hashing puzzle, but you still want enough time to happen in between each block so that the next validator can receive and verify it before building on top of it.

author: .someoneanonymous
content: I might be misunderstanding, but there isn’t a penalty involved, it just takes time for the block data (and transactions in it) to be replicated to other nodes, and then those nodes need to run each transaction and verify the block was valid. Once they do that, they (if they’re a miner) can start building the next block. During that time that they’re waiting for the previous block, whoever found it is already trying to find the next one.
